page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: This is a rural area on the edge of a zone of industrial development in the Mid Mersey Valley to the North, especially the expanding town of Warrington. There are some wooded areas, but the land is used mainly for agriculture both cereal farming and dairy farming. The block is divided North to South by the M6 motorway on the Thelwall Viaduct over the Mersey and the Manchester Ship Canal. In the South of the block much land is taken up by the M6/M56 interchange. The North East corner of the block just includes the southern edge of the dormitory village of Lymm. The North West corner of the block just includes the southern edge of the Warrington suburb of Grappenhall, formerly a separate village..
